node.title: Watch: 'She decided to do the right thing' - Speaker's tribute to Tova O'Brien
node.description: "Tova had the choice of probably the biggest parliamentary story possible, or a member's mental health."
node.content: ["House Speaker Trevor Mallard has given a rare tribute to a journalist - Newshub's outgoing political editor Tova O'Brien.\u00a0", "\"I want to acknowledge the media. I think they act with incredible integrity... probably with a couple of exceptions,\" Mallard said in his final speech in Parliament for 2021.\u00a0", "\"I do want to acknowledge Tova O'Brien leaving. Tova's first big hit as a television journalist was set in Naenae and involved some tickets to Homegrown being resold.\u00a0She got a very good hit and I got pretty embarrassed.\"", "O'Brien revealed in 2012 that Mallard, who helped pass a law to stop ticket scalping of big events, found himself the subject of ridicule after scalping four festival tickets and making a tidy profit.", "\"But the thing that I really want to acknowledge is that in her time here, Tova had the choice of probably the biggest parliamentary story possible, or a member's mental health, and she chose not to go for the hits and the sound bites,\" Mallard said.\u00a0", "\"She decided to do the right thing and I want to thank her for doing that.\u00a0", "\"It's not easy and it's not the way the media works and I just want to acknowledge a truly professional and compassionate journalist - even if I disagree with her on a few issues.\""]
